method.text: Heat the butter and oil in a heatproof dish for 1 min on 100% (FULL) power until butter is melted. Add the onion and cook on 100% (FULL) power for 2 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> min until transparent.

Add a little seasoning to the flour and use to coat the chicken strips. Add to the dish. Cook on 100% (FULL) power for 4-6 min until chicken is no longer pink, stirring the strips and shaking the dish a few times during cooking.
Stir the wine into the dish. Cook on 100% (FULL) power for a further 4-5 min until chicken is cooked. Transfer chicken with a slotted spoon to a hot serving dish. Keep warm.
Drain off all but 15 ml of the juices from the dish. Stir in the soured cream and beat in the mustard. Adjust the seasoning and heat gently on 30% (MEDIUM LOW) power for 4-5 min.
Meanwhile, halve and stone the avocado. Carefully peel and then cut into thin slices, then toss in the lemon juice to prevent discoloration.
Stir the chicken and the drained and sliced avocado into the soured cream mixture and heat gently on 30% (MEDIUM LOW) power for a couple of minutes. Serve.
